alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 2:32PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts of 15 to 18 inches over the mountains above 3500 feet elevation. Winds gusting 45 to 65 mph over the exposed higher mountains and 30 to 45 mph for elevations below 3500 feet. * WHERE...Eastern Curry County and Josephine County above 2000 feet. This includes Grayback Road between O`Brien and Happy Camp, Highway 46 east of Cave Junction as well as the Kalmiopsis and Siskiyou Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
